entries.meaning: (ecology, of a parasite or dependent organism) The fact of completing an entire life cycle on a single host species.
examples: This may possibly be explained by autoecism (pine-to-pine spread) in the aecial stage of the rust, but autoecism has not been conclusively proved (Spaulding, 1922).

entries.meaning: (botany, of a plant) The fact of having male and female reproductive organs on the same individual plant.
examples: Along with this view of pleomorphism, goes the generally conceived idea that autoecism is the primitive condition, heteroecism being considered a later adaptation (Klebahn, 1904).
